newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX natgas down late on weather, holds support.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX natgas down late on weather, holds support.

text.p: NYMEX natgas futures, pressured by forecasts for more moderate weather next week, remained sharply lower late Thursday in moderate trade, but chartists noted prices were still holding above support.
At 1500 EST, February was still down by 25.1 cents at $3.36 per million British thermal units, while March was 20.5 cents lower at $2.94. Most others also were down.
"We held support at $3.30 (basis February) twice today. Risk-reward says up from here," said one Midwest trader, noting any sign of cold weather should boost prices again.

Despite some bearish sentiment from the near-term weather forecasts, some noted another Arctic wave was due to descend into the Midwest later next week, bringing more well-below normal temperatures to the eastern half of the nation.
Technically, traders pegged February support in the $3.30 area and then in the gap between $3.11 and $3.185. Resistance was seen at $3.64 and then in the $3.80-3.84 area.

In the cash, prices at the Gulf Coast jumped almost 40 cents Thursday to near $4.70. Midcon pipes tumbled almost 40 cents to the $4.80 area on forecasts for more moderate temperatures this weekend. Gas at the New York city gate was talked in the $6.00-6.50 area, up more than $1 on the day.
